title: About time to bring this up again (CR Kassadin.)

replies.body:
"I want"

This ^ is the crux of your whole point.

I want this! I want that! why aren't you doing what i want fast enough?!

just let them do it ffs, i dunno if you've ever tried to move any kind of large money around, but sometimes it takes half a year to even get a reply from some organisations, especially if the council or government are involved in any way. Give riot a break, they aren't just gunna steal the money so therefore IT WILL HAPPEN, just give it time.

Well they screwed us over with the skin, the least they could do is tell us how much they're donating. After all it's been almost 2 months now, it shouldn't take that long to figure out how many people bought it and do the calculations.

So by giving us the coolest looking server skin ever released they screwed us over? wow...

Almost 2 months is nothing for a corporation, (for both Riot and the receiver of the donation) this stuff takes time. 
when people are moving that much money, its not "hey Bob its Lenny, ill transfer you over X amount from my iPhone bank app tomorrow"
there are all kinds of fees, Lawyers will probably be involved when moving that amount of money, (to ensure the money is actually spent on research and not buying new cars for the scientists) and god knows lawyers don't work instantly, PR and Media companies will need to be included, preparations will need to be organised for that as well (for both sides) 

As to the amount being donated, where do you think all the lawyer and media company fees come from? as well as all the miscellaneous costs such as a thanks plaque etc etc. Neither party is expected to pay for that out of their own pocket, otherwise no donations would ever happen. Riot probably don't even know themselves how much of the money will be be left to be donated after all those costs are done.
and that cant afford to publicly say "we have raised X amount" and then when they hand the cheque over its for Y amount (after all the expenses) because then they will get all kinds of flak from people who don't understand.

Its like when you donate $2 to buy water for children in africa, your whole $2 doesn't go towards water, some of it goes towards hiring a cargo plane to take the water to the children, some of the money goes to pay for the sign that told you to donate the $2 some of it goes to pay the salary of the person who organises it etc etc. you are only probably spending 10c on the actual water itself, but you don't ring up the charity and ask them exactly how much of your money went to purchasing the actual water do you?

Also when you donate your $2, the children don't get the water the very next day! it takes months for that process to happen.

And its always possible (however unlikely)  that enough people were butthurt that they didn't get Vi in a kangaroo suit with a silver fern in one hand and a coconut in the other. That they didn't buy the skin, and so Riot didn't raise as much money as they had hoped and so are now trying to figure out how to proceed with insufficient funds. (which is more your fault than theirs)

Just accept that whatever the circumstance, it WILL happen, and after all you personally aren't gaining or losing anything from this process so why all the rush?

>Almost 2 months is nothing for a corporation

Just so we are clear, we are going to be on the verge of 4 months.
No? The "event" took place at the end of October, which was about 1 and a half months ago.

I'm not taking it from the event, i am taking it from this.

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/yHhIOYjO-letos-talk-about-the-server-skin

2.5 years of planning and they give us a shitty skin.

4 months of announcement and they cannot even pull out an excel spreadsheet and crunch the numbers.

I think they were too busy with 5.2 to care for anything and just rushed this skin deal to sooth most of us over, it did work, but not quite well enough.

Whether it's a 'shitty skin' is about as objective as it gets. Different people have different tastes, I love the skin, you hate the skin, we have differing opinion, saying 'it's a shitty skin because I don't like it' is about the most useless and invalid argument you can actually give so I really wish people would stop trying to use it as one.

'4 months'? As Sesshoumaru said, **6** months is nothing for a company and he's right. I wouldn't be suprised if this took more than a year. Picking the right charity (i.e one that spends 90+% on the program and <10% on administration/transport/etc etc) is hard enough and takes long enough. Getting any of those charities to respond in any short amount of time is pretty much impossible. Charities are swamped with work and they often have a very minimal budget to keep things on track.

As for making an excel spreadsheet and crunching numbers, no they can't, because the numbers are still changing. It's not as simple as 'players gave us 30 apples so charity gets 30 apples' It's more like, 'players gave us 30 apples, now we give one apple to our lawyer, one apple to the man with the cart who is going to move the apples, one apple to the in house costs of doing so, there might be a few other apples we have to give out to various people along the way to keep things moving. The the charity might take a couple of those apples to cover their costs and in the end anywhere between 20-27 of those apples actually go to a program'. So no they can't just run a spreadsheet, because the numbers are still variable, and trying to keep that number as high as possible takes time.

The teams that work on patches (balance team/champion team/skin team etc etc) are all separate from the people working on the actual business end. This is not a valid argument, because these are completely different people you are talking about. The 'delays' which are non-existent as there is no timeline for this decision have NOTHING to do with preseason.

Why the bloody hell are we bringing this up again? If you care so much about it then get off your high horse and do your damn research into why such a thing would take time. You are keeping obnoxiously high standards of a process you all know little to nothing about with a company that hasn't done it before and has never given you any precedence for those standards. You can't just oversimplify and pretend that's how the world works. Why don't we just give food to the kids in Africa? Because it's not that damn simple. Are you gonna fly to Africa with your leftover dinner in an eski and give it to them? You wouldn't even make it through customs. Moving large sums of money around TAKES TIME. 4 months is NOT TIME. Not from a large business perspective. 1 year would likely be excellent work on their part. 

Why do people on here like to just scapegoat Riot into the big bad? They are by far one of the most user friendly companies in the world, and you take the shit out of them like they don't do so much for you. Would you rather League was owned by a company like EA who would churn out low quality skins with no passion behind? churn out low quality champions with no story and no spark? Let the game's balance go to shit until people start leaving and they start losing money? Release a new version of the game with fancy new graphics every couple of years and charge you way too much money for it? Riot has become what it is because they have accountability. We get to communicate with the people who actually play the game. There is personality and passion behind it instead of just some cold money making machine. Riot CHOSE the free to play model and they didn't have to. With the new crafting system coming they are giving us more way to get content THEY sunk a boatload of money into FOR FREE. So why on this earth are there people who think it's 'right' or 'good' or 'valid' to treat them like they're freaking Satan? Because they aren't magic and can't do things instantly? Please.

Im not sure what the system is like in Australia but in New Zealand we have an organisation called Studylink where when you go to university you can take out a student loan from them to cover the costs of the uni fees.

it took them 6 months to pay my fees to the university, and all they needed to do was literally transfer $6000 to the university and bill me for it, And unlike the situation here, There were no lawyers to consult, no major companies getting publicity, and the amount of money is nothing compared to what Riot are donating, and that took 6 whole months. 
like i said, money changing hands takes AGES!

Put it in perspective, and stop complaining.

That is a little different, I would assume you still had to sign paperwork, get approval and all that jazz. Just because lawyers are not involved does not mean much.

I signed up to an online course here in Australia, it took me like 2 weeks to be enrolled and have my fees paid by the Government. We have a bit of an easier situation here, you get allocated X amount for your whole life that can be used on any approved course, when you earn over a certain amount before tax you have to start paying it back, simple.

Now looking at donations, how hard is it to contact the other organisation and make out a cheque or organise a transfer? Maybe if they were transferring the money from US to OCE somewhere it may take time, but even than it shouldn't take very long considering they are just giving money away and not making a deal that they have to pay something back or whatnot.

I make regular monthly donations, it took 5 minutes to setup and at the end of the financial year I get a statement I can use for tax purposes, why is adding a few more zeros an issue?

It would be pretty easy to just transfer over the money, but neither side wants that, both sides want the publicity that comes with a large donation and that takes time to set up properly.
Plus its easy to give money to a research institute such as a university, but making sure that they money you give them is spent on actually researching and not renovating the carpark is another matter, you need lawyers to make a contract in that case. Thats why its a little more complicated than just adding a few more zeros

also that system sounds much easier than the NZ one haha xD

> So by giving us the coolest looking server skin ever released they screwed us over?

No. By giving us plenty of reason to think the OCE skin would be treated no differently than any other server skin for 2 and a half years and then telling us that it was going to be different because Riot are basically greedy f*cks who don't care about OCE they screwed us over. I never denied that the skin, in itself, isn't a good skin, but it's all just a money grab for Riot and doesn't represent OCE as opposed to Brazil or anywhere else in the southern hemisphere (or anywhere else on earth if you don't consider the splash art).

It also doesn't take almost 2 months to do some calculations to figure out how much was raised from the "event". All it would take is one person over half an hour (at most) as long as they had all the relevant values (percentage of profit to be donated, total profit from a single purchase, total number of skins purchased), which Riot would most definitely have at this point.

it represents us fine.

I suppose you think russians were perfectly happy that their country was represented by a manly woman riding a bear?
that has nothing at all to do with russia, the only russian thing about it is the little red star on her hat, and i bet not all Russians were pleased that their entire nation was represented only by the red star of communism.
If we are using political symbols now why not just have a swastica on the european skin? I'm sure that'll impress.

Remember that it was the community who pestered riot almost every day about hurrying up the skin, maybe if you all had been more patent, you might be a little happier with the outcome. The way i see it, we have no right to complain, (and why should we its way better than all the other server skins anyway)

Also you obviously didn't read my post. because i explained the possible reasons why they cant tell you how much they made, I'm not going to re-write it because you didn't either: (A) Listen or (B) Understand.

That skin does not represent us fine, all I seen come out of it was the Southern Cross, they could have placed that in any champion skin and call it an OCE skin.

They needed to make something that actually incorporates the OCE way of life, hell, even Surfer Singed is a better skin that represents us more than this Kassadin skin.

they had enough time to make up their minds of what they were going to give us, it is about time they actually held up their end of the bargain.

"They could have placed that in any champion skin and call it an OCE skin"
thanks you just proved my point that it is OCE related?

"they needed to make something that actually incorporates the OCE way of life"
Not like the southern cross guided the First explorers to find our countries, or the trade ships that supplied them and allowed them to grow to what they are today, nah lets have something real important like a hat with corks on it that keeps away flies!

You realize that the southern cross is the only thing that makes this skin OCE related, and that's only in the splash art and in one animation, if you take out the southern cross, i would have assumed it was based on some greek mythology honestly.

And that is why it's not OCE related, like sure stars are in OCE, but they are also visible all over the world.

Its not visible all over the world, most of the northern hemisphere cant see it at all and the rest of it can only see it or part of it for a short time each year. 

and duh! if you take the southern cross away it is no longer OCE related, thats why its there in the first place!

And the only thing that makes Bear rider Sejuani Russian is her hat, if you take that away it ALSO could be from anything, so i fail to understand your point?

You didn't read what that was replying to did you? oops xD

anyway you go away and design us a skin that properly and concisely represents Australia, New Zealand, Guam, New Caledonia, French Polynesia and Fiji (plus all the other individual cook islands) AND NOTHING ELSE! thats important! your skin has to represent perfectly just those places and NOTHING else.

and once you do that and none of those places feel left out or offended or biased towards one or the other, THEN i might start sympathising with you. but until you can do perfectly what you are blaming someone else for not doing then I'm afraid your argument is hollow.

I'm not saying it has to perfectly represent the entire OCE region, but it shouldn't represent basically the entire southern hemisphere (or basically the entire universe).

There were plenty of good ideas from the community of what kind of skin Riot could create, but instead that took one they were probably already making, slapped a southern cross on the splash art, said "good enough" and didn't even have the courtesy to treat it the same as other server skins.

seriously dude your posts regarding this are just brown nosing at this point, if you think the only reason bear rider sejuani is Russian is her hat, you need to go learn some other cultures.

This ignorance aside, fact is it's taken them 2 years, and the best they could come up with is slapping the southern cross on what was probably already a finished non-server skin, and just made it a server skin.

And yes i understand the southern cross is only visible around this area, this doesn't make a server skin acceptable to just have this as the only fucking connection.

Legitmately i have no actual thoughts that they did anything but slap the southern cross on a skin and call it a server one, hell i relate this skin more to greek mythology and such over OCE.

I do think that only Russian thing about her is her hat,
the fact that she rides a bear is reference to a FICTIONAL internet sensation, armed bear riders did not actually exist. So unless you're willing to argue that a fictional creation is more relevant to a country, than the group of starts that led to the discovery and growth of another 2 counties (and appears on said flags). then you're argument has no validity.
what else do we have in her skin? snow? well of course it MUST be Russia it has SNOW! my bad guys...

As for taking two years, you try make a skin for the most diverse server in lol! (and i want to see it when you're done) you have to think about Australia, New Zealand, Guam, New Caledonia, French Polynesia and Fiji (plus all the other individual cook islands) Now in your skin you cant offend or leave out any of the countries or be biased to one or the other. You might find that it isn't as easy as you make it sound. 

they took 2 years to do it and still didn't get it right for everyone (according to you) so maybe we should have given them longer? except no, we had everyone on the boards pestering them to bring it out faster, and what happens when you rush things? they don't turn out as good as you want them to be.

> you just proved my point that it is OCE related?

As well as Brazil related, Argentina related, Peru related, Madagascar related, Swaziland related, Zimbabwe related etc.

And by "us" you mean?

Honestly, what's the go here? What's the one size fits all for the region?

Did you want to talk about what Rito allow on the OCE server? Or what countries are actually in the Oceania region? Because there are some islands that belong to other countries that are not considered OCE, but because they fall in the OCE geographic region they are classified as here, like Hawaii.

We can look at two of the biggest things here, Culture and Sport. Most of the islands here, even Hawaii, have a similar native culture, that is a good start. Place a native skin on someone like Nidalee, that would fight perfectly.

Or if you look at sport we have Rugby and Cricket, you could give someone a cricket bat and baggy whites, or you can give someone a rugby uniform of some sort and a rugby ball. Or even go for a team of rugby players, there are four options for you.

There are options, what Rito should have done is look at what actually represents the OCE region, not what they think represents us.

> it represents us fine.

Along with the rest of the world.

Wrong.

"_the least they could_" is deliver and donate to a charity. Telling how much is not in the "_the least_".
no chill lol

> "the least they could" is deliver and donate to a charity.

That's closer to "the most you could do" and the most you could've done is treated the OCE skin like all other server skins and not charged everyone to be able to get it.

> Telling how much is not in the "the least".

It is at this stage.

Hey everyone - I know there is a lot of discussion going on. I posted an updated on our charity selection here: http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/BL2VyFqU-cosmic-reaver-kassadin-charitable-donation-update 

We are about to hit the holidays, but I'll do my best to make time to answer questions, etc.
Charity is just their cover, its like how Maccas actually keep 80% of the money in the fundraiser boxes

Jason,

keeping bumping this is not helping anyone.
Delivering this project and the artificial reef are the top 2 priorities we have in OCE.
It just takes time when other organisation  are involved.

Please just relax and be assured we will deliver.
MM

Firstly, the only person complaining about how the skin is sh!t is Gintanimo, and it seems their only valid point is how the Southern Cross doesn't make CR Kass automatically represent OCE.

Secondly, there are several reasons why treating the OCE server skin differently to all previous server skins is a cop out to the OCE region. One such reason is Riot's excuse for doing so, being that they "don't want to set a precedence going forward that new servers would receive *multiple* free skins" despite the fact they've already done that with other servers.

Thirdly, while the charity idea is good the only reason it's being used currently is so Riot can keep up their image. The only reason they decided to do that was so they could put more money in their pockets without a majority of the community getting pissed at them.

Lastly, this has ***supposedly*** been the plan for a **long** time now which means, if they were smart, Riot should have already done plenty of research on which charities they could possibly donate the money to. In fact they could have probably had it all ready to go by now if that was the case, but it's not.

Seconded.

After all, based on what Riot has told us they've had 2 and a half years to do this research.

Times up Rito.
